Title: Junior Marketing Analyst
Description: Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed. The role of a Junior Marketing Analyst at Canonical Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier. The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you. This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager. Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region. What your day will look like Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards What we are looking for in you? Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc) Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc) Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings Excellent writing and communication skills Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges What we offer you Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce. In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process. üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum üí∞Annual compensation review üèÜRecognition rewards üèù Annual holiday leave üë∂Parental Leave üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' ‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration. Title: Expert Energiewirtschaft
Description: Das erwartet dich bei uns: Die Energiewelt ist in Bewegung! Wir sind ein praxisnahes Dienstleistungsunternehmen f√ºr die Energiewirtschaft und helfen unseren Kunden seit 20 Jahren die Herausforderungen der Digitalisierung sowie der signifikanten regulatorischen Ver√§nderungen zu bew√§ltigen. Durch Fachkompetenz und Engagement √ºberzeugen wir in Kundenprojekten und √ºbernehmen gern Verantwortung. Dabei teilen wir in der Unternehmensgruppe die Leidenschaft f√ºr die Branche. Du hast bereits Erfahrung in der Energiewirtschaft gesammelt und Lust, deine Kompetenzen in unseren Projekten einzubringen? Dann komm zu uns als erfahrener Experte Energiewirtschaft und gestalte die Energiewende mit. Das k√∂nnte dein neues Arbeitsumfeld in unseren Kundenprojekten sein: systemnahe Prozessunterst√ºtzung in wechselnden Themen der Branche und Kundenumgebungen IT-Transformation: Umsetzung von Digitalisierungsl√∂sungen zur weiteren Automatisierung von Prozessen Regulierung & Energiewende: Unterst√ºtzung unserer Kunden bei der Einhaltung regulatorischer Anforderungen Innovation: Weiterentwicklung unseres Leistungsportfolios in Zusammenarbeit mit der Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung Wir suchen zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt Prozessexperten in den folgenden Bereichen: Messstellenbetrieb Abrechnung Bilanzierung Energiedatenmanagement Lieferantenwechsel/Versorgungskl√§rung Marktkommunikation Junior Data Analyst Das bringst du idealerweise mit: Fachliche Kompetenz ‚Äì Ein abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung im Bereich Energiewirtschaft, Ingenieurwesen oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen ist ideal, aber nicht zwingend erforderlich. Berufserfahrung ‚Äì Du kennst dich mit energiewirtschaftlichen Prozessen und IT-Systemen aus, sei es durch Berufserfahrung bei einem Netzbetreiber, Lieferanten, Messstellenbetreiber oder Dienstleister . Eigenverantwortung ‚Äì Du arbeitest selbstst√§ndig und souver√§n, denn du repr√§sentierst unser Unternehmen beim Kunden. Analytisches Denken ‚Äì Du erkennst Zusammenh√§nge, wertest sie aus und gibst gezieltes Feedback an Kunden oder Projektleiter weiter. Kommunikationsst√§rke ‚Äì Ob mit Kunden, Partnern oder Kollegen ‚Äì du kommunizierst klar, professionell und auf Augenh√∂he. Flexibilit√§t & Belastbarkeit ‚Äì Auch in einem dynamischen Umfeld bleibst du gelassen und beh√§ltst den √úberblick. IT-Affinit√§t ‚Äì Du bist sicher im Umgang mit MS Office und hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit energiewirtschaftlichen IT-Systemen wie SAP, Wilken, Robotron, Schleupen oder Lima . Teamgeist ‚Äì Selbst wenn du eigenst√§ndig arbeitest, sch√§tzt du den Austausch mit deinen Kollegen. Sprache ‚Äì Deutsch auf mindestens B2-Niveau ist erforderlich. Das bieten wir Dir: Verantwortung in den Projekten Vielf√§ltiges Arbeitsumfeld remote Arbeiten: standortunabh√§ngig f√ºr h√∂here work-life-Balance bis zu 40 Tage pro Jahr remote work im EU Ausland Weiterbildungen zum Ausbau der fachlichen & methodischen Expertise individuelle und flexible Arbeitszeiten: 40 Stunden sind kein Muss Mentoring f√ºr die pers√∂nliche Weiterentwicklung strukturiertes Onboarding Firmenevents f√ºr Abwechslung und Zusammenhalt Viele Job Benefits f√ºr Verm√∂gensaufbau, Vorsorge, Gesundheit und Sport Unbefristete Arbeitsvertr√§ge mit fairer Verg√ºtung Kontaktinformationen Fragen zu dieser Position oder anderen Themen rund um UTILITY PARTNERS Operations beantwortet dir Christian Vogel unter bewerbung@utility-partners.de Show more Show less

Title: Senior CPM Consultant (m/w/d)
Description: Bist du bereit, gemeinsam mit uns die n√§chste Stufe zu erreichen? Werde Teil unserer Mission und gestalte die Zukunft aktiv mit! Jetzt bewerben M√∂chtest du in einem zukunftsorientierten Team arbeiten und die Unternehmenswelt aktiv mitgestalten? Hier ist deine Gelegenheit! Die TD Trusted Decisions GmbH ist eine Managementberatung und entwickelt innovative, methodische L√∂sungen, die alle Aspekte der Unternehmenssteuerung nahtlos miteinander verkn√ºpfen. Bei uns bist du nicht nur ein Berater ‚Äì du bist ein Gestalter, der die Entscheidungskraft st√§rken und somit das Fundament f√ºr zukunftsf√§hige Unternehmen legen will. Mit einem ganzheitlichen Blickwinkel unterst√ºtzen wir sowohl mittelst√§ndische als auch gro√üe Unternehmen, ihre Informationsstr√∂me zu optimieren. Hand in Hand kreieren wir eine integrierte, ma√ügeschneiderte Informationswelt, die Bereiche wie BI, Controlling, Reporting und Analyse abdeckt. Und dank unserer zertifizierten Partnerschaften mit Schwergewichten wie Qlik und Corporate Planning greifen wir auf eine tiefe Expertise und bew√§hrte Beziehungen zur√ºck. Als Senior Consultant (m/w/d) im Bereich Corporate Performance Management wirst du ma√ügeschneiderte Business Intelligence L√∂sungen gestalten, die unseren Kunden helfen, die richtigen Entscheidungen zu treffen. Und das Sch√∂nste? Du hast die Freiheit, in Vollzeit oder Teilzeit zu arbeiten, sei es in unserem B√ºro in Hamburg , im Homeoffice oder direkt beim Kunden. Deine Aufgaben bei TD Trusted Decisions Du √ºbernimmst die F√ºhrung in der betriebswirtschaftlichen Beratung und sorgst f√ºr die erfolgreiche Implementierung der Produkte unserer Partner, Corporate Planning und Qlik, bei unseren namhaften Kunden. Du begleitest und steuerst unsere Kundenprojekte in allen Phasen, von der strategischen Konzeption bis hin zur finalen Implementierung. Als renommierter Fachexperte bist du der erste Ansprechpartner f√ºr unsere Kunden in den Bereichen integrierte Finanzplanung, operative Planung und Management Reporting. Du entwickelst und leitest fortgeschrittene Software-Schulungen zu den genannten Themen und tr√§gst ma√ügeblich zur Weiterbildung unserer Kunden und Kollegen bei. Dein Profil Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein abgeschlossenes betriebswirtschaftliches Studium oder ein Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, vorzugsweise mit einem Fokus auf Controlling, oder eine h√∂herwertige kaufm√§nnische Ausbildung. Du bringst umfangreiche Berufs- und Projekterfahrung im Bereich Corporate Performance Management mit und hast tiefe Kenntnisse im Finance- und Controlling-Bereich. Deine ausgezeichnete Zahlenaffinit√§t geht Hand in Hand mit einer tiefen Software-Expertise und einem profunden buchhalterischen Verst√§ndnis. Dein Expertenwissen umfasst die Verkn√ºpfungen einer integrierten GuV-, Bilanz- und Liquidit√§tsplanung. Du meisterst MS Office auf Expertenebene, und der versierte Umgang mit Scrum- und Collaboration-Tools ist f√ºr dich selbstverst√§ndlich. Dein Auftreten ist souver√§n und √ºberzeugend, kombiniert mit einer ausgezeichneten Kundenorientierung. Deine Arbeitsweise ist eigenverantwortlich und zuverl√§ssig. Dabei beweist du starke Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten und sch√§tzt die Dynamik der Teamarbeit. F√ºr diese Position sind exzellente schriftliche und m√ºndliche Deutschkenntnisse unerl√§sslich, wobei wir mindestens ein Deutsch-Niveau nach dem GER von C2 erwarten. Title: Jr. Payments Data Analyst/ Intern
Description: Location : Remote (or specify location if applicable) Type : Internship (Paid)/ Junior role Duration : For internship 3-6 months (with the possibility of extension or full-time role) At Congrify we are a payments data observability and intelligence company. We enable merchants and payment service providers increasing revenues, optimizing costs, ensuring compliant and efficient reconciliation processes. Payment professionals can free up their time without needing to spend hours in bringing together data from multiple payment service providers and data sources, thanks to our no-code tools all the payments data and insights are available within seconds, allowing users to focus on taking actions and increasing their businesses success. We are looking for a driven and motivated Jr. Payments Data Analyst/ Intern to join our dynamic, hybrid team. This role offers the unique opportunity to be a key contributor to our growth and success. You will play a pivotal role in developing and enhancing our data analytics product, understanding payments performances while directly impacting our clients‚Äô ability to optimize their payment processes. As we scale, you will have the chance to evolve into a leadership position and shape the future direction of our company. Tasks Collaborate with the analytics team to extract, clean, and preprocess payment and transaction data. Conduct ad-hoc data analysis on merchant performance, payment trends, and platform monitoring metrics. Assist in creating dashboards and visualizations using tools like Grafana, Tableau, or similar platforms. Identify anomalies, trends, and opportunities in payment data to support decision-making. Contribute to the development of reports for clients and internal needs. Ensure data integrity by identifying and addressing inconsistencies or errors. Analyze payment success rates, chargebacks, and other key metrics. Summarize key findings and present them in clear, actionable formats. Monitor payment platform metrics for anomalies or irregularities. Requirements Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science , Statistics , Economics , Computer Science , or a related field. Basic understanding of the payments, fintech, or e-commerce industries (preferred but not mandatory). Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, querying and experience with Python or R for data analysis. Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI , Tableau , or equivalent platforms. Knowledge of basic statistical methods and their application in data analysis. Exposure to working with large datasets and handling data quality issues. Understanding of basic data engineering concepts, such as ETL processes or API integrations (a plus). Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently with minimal supervision. Proactive approach to learning and applying new tools or concepts. A curious and innovative mindset with a passion for fintech and data-driven decision-making. For interns: availability for 20-40 hours per week, depending on the internship duration. Benefits Hands-on experience working with real-world payment and transaction data. Opportunity to learn directly from industry experts, including professionals with decades of experience in fintech and data engineering. Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and analytics tools used in the payments industry. Development of analytical, problem-solving, and data visualization skills. Potential for a full-time role upon successful completion of the internship. Opportunity to build a strong foundation in the rapidly growing fintech and payments sector. Valuable experience to enhance your CV and career prospects in data analysis and fintech. Join Congrify as a Junior Payments Data Analyst/Intern and kickstart your career in the dynamic world of fintech. Gain hands-on experience, work with industry experts, and make a real impact on innovative projects. We look forward to welcoming you to our team! Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description: Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed. The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier. The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you. This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager. Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region. What your day will look like Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards What we are looking for in you? Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc) Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc) Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings Excellent writing and communication skills Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges What we offer you Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce. In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process. üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum üí∞Annual compensation review üèÜRecognition rewards üèù Annual holiday leave üë∂Parental Leave üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' ‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration. Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description: Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed. The role of a Junior Data Engineer at Canonical Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier. The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving data engineering, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you. This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager. Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region. What your day will look like Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards What we are looking for in you? Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc) Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc) Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings Excellent writing and communication skills Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges What we offer you Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce. In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Title: Junior Marketing Analyst
Description: Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed. The role of a Junior Marketing Analyst at Canonical Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier. The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you. This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager. Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region. What your day will look like Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards What we are looking for in you? Background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc) Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc) Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings Excellent writing and communication skills Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges What we offer you Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce. In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process. üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004! üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum üí∞Annual compensation review üèÜRecognition rewards üèù Annual holiday leave üë∂Parental Leave üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints' ‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
